      For each time unit, the equiJoin construct joins input items from two categories using a binary function, where these input items share the same key (specified by getKey1 and getKey2), and they are valid in the current time unit.
      static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> FFT(int wndSize, int bufferSize)
      The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.

      The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.

      static <A,B> Q<A,B> filterMap(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate, utils.lambda.Func1<A,B> func)
      The filterMap construct first applies a filter query to the input stream and then applies a map query to the output of the filter query, which is a syntactical sugar for pipeline(filter, map).

      • distinct

        public static <A> Q<A,A> distinct()
        The distinct construct echoes the input stream with the removal of duplicated data items. The equivalence is decided by Java's equals() method.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input/output item
        Returns:
        a query that implements the distinct construct

      • take

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> take(Q<A,B> query,
                                int num)
        Given an integer num that is larger than 0, the take construct sends its input stream to query. It echoes the first num output items from query and halts. This is more efficient than pipeline(query, take(num)).
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        query - query whose output will be taken
        num - number of items to be taken
        Returns:
        a query that implements the take construct

      • takeUntil

        public static <A> Q<A,A> takeUntil(java.util.function.Predicate<A> predicate)
        Given a predicate, the takeUntil construct echoes the input items until the first time the input item satisfies the predicate, and it immediately halts.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input/output item
        Parameters:
        predicate - predicate
        Returns:
        a query that implements the takeUntil construct

      • takeUntil

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> takeUntil(Q<A,B> query,
                                     java.util.function.Predicate<B> predicate)
        Given a predicate, the takeUntil construct sends its input stream to query. It echoes the output items from query until the first time the output item from query satisfies the predicate, and it immediately halts. This is more efficient than pipeline(query, takeUntil(predicate)).
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        query - query whose output will be taken
        predicate - predicate
        Returns:
        a query that implements the takeUntil construct

      • takeWhen

        public static <A> Q<A,A> takeWhen(java.util.function.Predicate<A> startPred,
                                  java.util.function.Predicate<A> endPred)
        The takeWhen construct skips the input items until the input item satisfies startPred, and it takes the rest of the stream until the input item satisfies endPred.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input/output item
        Parameters:
        startPred - predicate for starting taking items from the input stream
        endPred - predicate for ending taking items from the input stream
        Returns:
        a query that implements the takeWhen construct

      • takeWhen

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> takeWhen(Q<A,B> query,
                                    java.util.function.Predicate<B> startPred,
                                    java.util.function.Predicate<B> endPred)
        The takeWhen construct sends its input stream to query. It skips the output items from query until the output item satisfies startPred, and it takes the rest of the output from query until the output item satisfies endPred. This is more efficient than pipeline(query, takeWhen(...))
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        query - query whose output is selected by the takeWhen query
        startPred - predicate for starting taking items from the input stream
        endPred - predicate for ending taking items from the input stream
        Returns:
        a query that implements the takeWhen construct

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> seq(Q<A,B> f1,
                               Q<A,B> f2)

        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        f1 - query that first processes the input stream
        f2 - query that secondly processes the input stream
        Returns:
        query that implements the temporal sequencing construct

        public static <A,B,C,K> Q<A,C> groupBy(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey,
                                       Q<A,B> query,
                                       utils.lambda.Func2<K,B,C> combine)
        The groupBy (key-partitioning) construct partitions the input stream by a key, obtained by the function getKey, and applies query to each partitioned sub-stream. The output of query will be combined with the key of the sub-stream that generates this output.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item from query
        C - type of the output item
        K - type of the key
        Parameters:

        query - query that is applied to each sub-stream
        combine - function that combines the output of the query and the key of the sub-stream
        Returns:
        a query that implements the groupBy construct

      • sWindow2

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> sWindow2(utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,B> func)

        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        func - function that reduces the elements in the sliding window
        Returns:

        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        func - function that reduces the elements in the sliding window
        Returns:
        a query that implements the sWindow3 construct

      • sWindow4

        public static <A,B> Q<A,B> sWindow4(utils.lambda.Func4<A,A,A,A,B> func)
        Given a function func that reduces 4 input items to an output item, sWindow4(func) applies this function to every 4 continuous input items, i.e., sliding-window (move-by-1) aggregation.

      • udf

        public static <A,S,B> Q<A,B> udf(java.util.Iterator<B> startItems,
                                 S init,
                                 utils.lambda.Func2<S,A,S> updateNext,
                                 utils.lambda.Func1<S,B> outNext,
                                 utils.lambda.Func1<S,S> updateEnd,
                                 utils.lambda.Func1<S,B> outEnd,
                                 java.util.Iterator<B> endItems)
        The user-defined construct allows users to describe user-defined streaming computations.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item
        S - type of the state
        B - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        startItems - items to be emitted when the input stream is empty
        init - initial state for stream computation
        updateNext - function that updates the state when a new input arrives
        outNext - function that generates output with regards to the arrival of each input item
        updateEnd - function that updates the state when the input terminates
        outEnd - function that generates output with regards to the termination of the input
        endItems - items to be emitted when the input stream terminates
        Returns:
        a query that implements the user-defined construct

      • FFT

        public static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> FFT(int wndSize,
                                                               int bufferSize)
        The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.
        Parameters:
        wndSize - size of the window
        bufferSize - size of the FFT buffer
        Returns:
        a query that implements the FFT construct

      • FFT

        public static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> FFT(int wndSize,
                                                               int bufferSize,
                                                               utils.algorithms.FFT.MaskWindow mask)
        The FFT construct performs Fast Fourier Transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the tumbling Window, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2. Moreover, mask specifies the type of mask applied to the window, which can be SQUARE_WINDOW, BARTLETT_WINDOW, HANNING_WINDOW, HAMMING_WINDOW, BLACKMAN_WINDOW, or GAUSSIAN_WINDOW.
        Parameters:
        wndSize - size of the window
        bufferSize - size of the FFT buffer
        mask - mask of the window
        Returns:
        a query that implements the FFT construct

      • STFT

        public static Q<java.lang.Double,utils.structures.Complex> STFT(int wndSize,
                                                                int slidingInterval,
                                                                int bufferSize)
        The STFT construct performs Short Time Fourier transformation on the input stream, where wndSize is the size of the window, slidingInterval is the sliding interval of STFT, and bufferSize is the size of the FFT buffer, which should be a power of 2.
        Parameters:
        wndSize - size of the window
        slidingInterval - sliding interval
        bufferSize - size of the FFT buffer
        Returns:
        a query that implements the STFT construct

Moreover, mask specifies the type of mask applied to the window, which can be SQUARE_WINDOW, BARTLETT_WINDOW, HANNING_WINDOW, HAMMING_WINDOW, BLACKMAN_WINDOW, or GAUSSIAN_WINDOW.

                                    utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> update)

      • sWndReduceI

        public static <A> Q<A,A> sWndReduceI(int wndSize,
                                     int interval,
                                     utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> add,
                                     utils.lambda.Func2<A,A,A> remove)
        The sWndReduceI construct splits the input stream into sliding windows and aggregates each window, where the initial value of the aggregation is the value of the first item in each window.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input/output item
        Parameters:
        wndSize - size of the window
        interval - sliding interval
        add - function that adds the newest input item in the window and updates the aggregate
        remove - function that removes the oldest input item in the window and updates the aggregate
        Returns:
        a query that implements the sWndReduceI construct

      • equiJoin

        public static <A,B,C,K> Q<utils.structures.Timed<utils.structures.Or<A,B>>,utils.structures.Timed<C>> equiJoin(utils.lambda.Func1<A,K> getKey1,
                                                                                                               utils.lambda.Func1<B,K> getKey2,
                                                                                                               utils.lambda.Func2<A,B,C> combine)
        For each time unit, the equiJoin construct joins input items from two categories using a binary function, where these input items share the same key (specified by getKey1 and getKey2), and they are valid in the current time unit.
        Type Parameters:
        A - type of the input item from one category
        B - type of the input item from another category
        K - type of the key
        C - type of the output item
        Parameters:
        combine - function that combines the output items from different categories
        getKey1 - function that specifies the key for each input item from one category
        getKey2 - function that specifies the key for each input item from another category
        Returns:
        a query that implements the equiJoin construct
